column4: lol, this guy just doesn't get it. He doesn't see why preventing hoary users from installing KDE unless they install KDE 3.4.1 (a massive upgrade) is a bad idea when he admits he could easily have used kde 3.4.0 dependencies but chose not to because he thinks users should use 3.4.1. He also apparently doesn't feel the need to tell users before hand that they need kde 3.4.1 to use his package!
he also violated the new backport guidelines. backported packages are supposed to use hoary libraries only
i'm hoping to become one meself
I'll bet you could compile that in
what irc client are you using now?
you're video and audio is mixing?
why are you telling him not to use the console? perhaps he wants to learn or maybe he's running a server in which case X is useless
I said, use the console for a week only
aptitude is another package manager frontend
so, you only use aptitude? you never use synaptic right?
